item.description: Wrap to Column is the plugin you’ll need if you need to wrap the comments in a different width than the code with JetBrains IDEs.
I’ve played with deno for awhile today, it seems to be very promising.
My tax return is done early this year! Woohoo!
Fever, broken foot, gout, broken arm. That’s a hell of a week!
I couldn’t hold myself off any longer, I’ve started to watch The Last Dance!

Just read Second-guessing the modern web. It’s a well written article on the current trend of building static content site with React SPA. I agree with it, that’s why this very site is still built with Hugo despite my familiarity with React and the recent hype of Gatsby.
I didn’t have too much memory of The Matrix Revolutions, and I didn’t expect it to be very good before re-watching it. But, man, I’ve enjoyed it a lot, it IS good!
Matrix movie series are so fun to (re)watch!

item.title: Start Learning Emacs
item.description: March 7th, 2019. I need to mark this date because on that day I decided to seriously learn Emacs and switch to it as my primary text editor after my 12 years Vim journey. Why? Because currently I am working on the new design of Gemsby and I have chosen to use TypeScript for the work. Unfortunately, TypeScript support in Vim is very weak at this moment, I need to spend a lot of time to fight my text editor which I would rather not to do.

item.title: New Dev Domains
item.description: Google opened its .dev domains for anyone to purchase without the early access fee a few days ago. Every developer should grab a .dev domain to showcase their great creations and works in my opinion, so I have grabbed TWO for myself üòÅ. I will need some time to figure out a better use of those domains, but for the time being, my shiny new domains, yeliu.dev and liuye.dev, will be redirect to here.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: This is where it all begins…

item.title: about
item.description: Hi there, I am Ye Liu. I am a software developer, who cannot live without Mac, Linux, and Vim, speaks JavaScript, Dart, Elm, Go, Elixir, Python and C, is passionate about web, mobile and cross-platform development, is crazy about things that are invisible but powerful. I can also be found on GitHub, StackOverflow and Twitter.
